osvSchema.details:
An Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization vulnerability in the Packet Forwarding Engine (pfe) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on QFX5000 Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS).

If a specific malformed LACP packet is received by a QFX5000 Series, or an EX4400, EX4100 or EX4650 Series device, an LACP flap will occur resulting in traffic loss.
This issue affects Junos OS on QFX5000 Series, and on EX4400, EX4100 or EX4650 Series:



  *  20.4 versions from 

20.4R3-S4

before 20.4R3-S8,
  *  21.2 versions from 

21.2R3-S2

before 21.2R3-S6,
  *  21.4 versions from 

21.4R2

before 21.4R3-S4,

  *  22.1 versions from

22.1R2

 before 22.1R3-S3,
  *  22.2 versions before 22.2R3-S1,
  *  22.3 versions before 22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3,
  *  22.4 versions before 22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3.

supportingMedia.value:
To be affected by this issue the device must have an LACP configuration as shown in the following example must be present:

  [ interfaces <interface> ...ether-options 802.3ad ae<number> ]
  [ interfaces ae<number> aggregated-ether-options lacp ]

configuration.value:
To be affected by this issue the device must have an LACP configuration as shown in the following example must be present:

  [ interfaces <interface> ...ether-options 802.3ad ae<number> ]
  [ interfaces ae<number> aggregated-ether-options lacp ]

description_data.value:
An Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization vulnerability in the Packet Forwarding Engine (pfe) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on QFX5000 Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS).

If a specific malformed LACP packet is received by a QFX5000 Series, or an EX4400, EX4100 or EX4650 Series device, an LACP flap will occur resulting in traffic loss.
This issue affects Junos OS on QFX5000 Series, and on EX4400, EX4100 or EX4650 Series:



  *  20.4 versions from 

20.4R3-S4

before 20.4R3-S8,
  *  21.2 versions from 

21.2R3-S2

before 21.2R3-S6,
  *  21.4 versions from 

21.4R2

before 21.4R3-S4,

  *  22.1 versions from

22.1R2

 before 22.1R3-S3,
  *  22.2 versions before 22.2R3-S1,
  *  22.3 versions before 22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3,
  *  22.4 versions before 22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3.

supportingMedia.value: Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

exploit.value: Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

supportingMedia.value: The following software releases have been updated to resolve this specific issue: 20.4R3-S8, 21.2R3-S6, 21.3R3-S5, 21.4R3-S4, 22.1R3-S3, 22.2R3-S1, 22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3, 22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3, 23.2R1, and all subsequent releases.

solution.value: The following software releases have been updated to resolve this specific issue: 20.4R3-S8, 21.2R3-S6, 21.3R3-S5, 21.4R3-S4, 22.1R3-S3, 22.2R3-S1, 22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3, 22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3, 23.2R1, and all subsequent releases.

work_around.value: There are no known workarounds for this issue.
